intro: Gnaphalium pyramidatum, commonly known as the pyramidal groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in late summer, and it produces fluffy, white seeds that are dispersed by the wind. The plant has a low-growing habit and is often found in disturbed or arid environments.
